fall.repository package

Submodules

fall.repository.base module

Base class for maintaining a repository of states.

class fall.repository.base.Repository(max_size: int = -1, valuation_policy: ValuationPolicy = ValuationPolicy.NoPolicy, classifier_constructor: Optional[Callable[[], Classifier]] = None, representation_constructor: Optional[Callable[[int], ConceptRepresentation]] = None, train_representation: bool = True)

Bases: object

A base repository of states. Handles memory management.

__init__(max_size: int = -1, valuation_policy: ValuationPolicy = ValuationPolicy.NoPolicy, classifier_constructor: Optional[Callable[[], Classifier]] = None, representation_constructor: Optional[Callable[[int], ConceptRepresentation]] = None, train_representation: bool = True) → None
max_size: int

Default -1 Maximum number of states able to be stored. -1 represents unlimited. Anything else requires a deletion valuation policy.

valuation_policy: ValiationPolicy Default NoPolicy

The valuation policy to use. Must be set if max_size != -1

classifier_constructor: Union[Callable[[], Classifier], None]

A function to generate a new classifier, or none. Must be set to a valid constructor to automatically construct states.

representation_constructor: Union[Callable[[int], ConceptRepresentation], None]

A function which takes a state_id to generate a new concept representation, or none. Must be set to a valid constructor to automatically construct states.

train_representation: bool

Whether or not new states train representations. Must be set to automatically construct states.

add(new_state: State, skip_memory_management: bool = False) → None

Add a new state to the repository. Throws an error if the state already exists. Parameters ———- new_state: State

The new state to add.

skip_memory_management: bool

Default: False Whether or not to skip memory management. Skipping may be useful to aid in transitioning away from the prev state, but apply_memory_management should be manually called after this is done.

add_next_state(skip_memory_management: bool = False) → State

Create and add a state with the next valid ID. Return this state. Can only use if classifier constructor is set. Parameters ———-

skip_memory_management: bool

Default: False Whether or not to skip memory management. Skipping may be useful to aid in transitioning away from the prev state, but apply_memory_management should be manually called after this is done.

add_transition(from_state: State, to_state: State, weight: int = 1, in_drift: bool = False, in_warning: bool = False) → None

Add a transition to the relevant finite state machines.

apply_memory_management() → None

Apply memory management to avoid storing more than self.max_size states.

apply_valuation_policy(state_id: int) → float

Apply the current valuation policy to a state_id. Returns the valuation.

The valuation should be a float representing the estimated benefit provided by the state in the future.

fifo_valuation(state: State) → float

FIFO policies value states by their age, with a more recent age valued higher.

get_repository_predictions(observation: Observation, prediction_mode: str) → Dict[int, Union[bool, str, int]]

Makes a prediction for states in the repository. Returns ——-

state_predictions: Dict[int, ClfTarget]

A dict of state_ids to their predictions. Contains all states if prediction_mode == “all”

otherwise only the active state prediciton.

lru_valuation(state: State) → float

LRU policies value states by the time since last use, with a more recent use valued higher.

make_next_state() → State

Construct a new state with the next state_id in the sequence.

make_state(state_id: int) → State

Construct a new state.

memory_management_deletion() → None

Process the deletion of a single state. We delete the state with minimum value with regards to the valuation_policy parameter.

remove(state: State) → None

remove a state from the repository. Throws an error if the state does not exists.

step_all(active_state_id: int, sample_weight: float = 1.0) → None

Call step on all states to update statistics.

fall.repository.comparers module

Classes to compare concept representations. Classes are required to maintain learnable weights over time.

class fall.repository.comparers.AbsoluteValueComparer

Bases: RepresentationComparer

A representation comparer which calculates similarity based on the absolute value difference in value between representations. Where multiple meta-features are present, only the first is compared.

We assume that values are in the range [0, 1]. Thus to return similarity, we return 1 - abs(difference). E.G: an absolute difference of 0 is a similarity of 1, while a difference of 1 is a similarity of 0.

__init__() → None
get_similarity(rep_a: ConceptRepresentation, rep_b: ConceptRepresentation) → float

Returns the similarity between concept representations.

class fall.repository.comparers.RepresentationComparer

Bases: Base, ABC

A base class able to compare concept representations. Different comparison strategies are available depending on representation. May maintain a set of weights to use during comparison.

Returns the similarity between concept representations.

get_state_rep_similarity(state_a: State, rep_b: ConceptRepresentation) → float

Returns the similarity between a state and a concept representations.

get_state_similarity(state_a: State, state_b: State) → float

Returns the similarity between states.

Train trainable components on the repository.

train_unsupervised(repository: Repository) → None

Train trainable components on the repository.

class fall.repository.transition_fsm.TransitionCounter

Bases: object

Tracks transition weights.

Add Direct transition between two states.

add_indirect(weight: float) → None

Add Indirect transition, i.e., mediated by some deleted state.

rem_direct(weight: float) → None

Remove Direct transition between two states.

rem_indirect(weight: float) → None

Remove Indirect transition, i.e., mediated by some deleted state.

class fall.repository.transition_fsm.TransitionFSM

Bases: object

Describes the transitions between states, or active state history. Can be used to calculate state priors. Uses an adjacency list internally. NOTE: States should have unique state_ids.

__init__() → None
add_transition(from_state_id: int, to_state_id: int, weight: int = 1) → None

Record a transition from a state with given id to another state with given id.

delete_state(del_state_id: int, retain_indirect_weight: bool = True) → None

Delete a state from the FSM. If retain_indirect_weight is set, we maintain weight between previous state and next states as indirect. Since we do not know how to assign this weight, it is proportional.

get_mle_prev_state(to_state_id: int) → Tuple[int, float]

Returns the id of the most likely previous state, and number of transitions. If no transitions exist, returns itself.

get_transition_weight(from_state_id: int, to_state_id: int, smoothing_weight: int = 0) → float

Get the weight associated with a given transition. If not found, return the min value.

Module contents

Handles the creation of a repository containing previously built states.

A data stream can be considered as a sequence of concepts associated with some underlying environmental context. Each concept may feature a distinct joint distribution of data, so should be learned by a distinct classifier. When concepts may reoccur over time, we wish to retain these classifiers for reuse, essentially creating a finite state machine. The code in this module handles the mechanisms for representing each state, and the repository which stores constructed states and their memory management.

class fall.repository.AbsoluteValueComparer

Bases: RepresentationComparer

A representation comparer which calculates similarity based on the absolute value difference in value between representations. Where multiple meta-features are present, only the first is compared.

We assume that values are in the range [0, 1]. Thus to return similarity, we return 1 - abs(difference). E.G: an absolute difference of 0 is a similarity of 1, while a difference of 1 is a similarity of 0.

__init__() → None
get_similarity(rep_a: ConceptRepresentation, rep_b: ConceptRepresentation) → float

Returns the similarity between concept representations.

Bases: Enum

An enumeration.
